intro: Cleome rubelloides, commonly known as redstem cleome, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cleomaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, round seeds. Its leaves are simple and often have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Cleome rubelloides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and relatively low maintenance requirements.
